At that time, a certain monk rose from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, and with palms joined addressed Venerable SÄriputta, saying:

Virtuous ones,

if there is a person who internally has desires, and internally has desires, not knowing as it truly is, one should know that he also has no pleasant conduct, no progressive conduct, and no diligence.
He abides in desire, his mind attached to desire at the end of life.
Having his mind attached to desire at the end of life, he does not end well, and is not reborn in a good place.
Why is it so?
Because his mind is attached to desire at the end.
It is just as, virtuous ones,
if a person, whether in a shop or a guest house, brings a copper bowl, soiled and impure.

Having taken it, they do not wash it in a timely manner, do not wipe it in a timely manner, and do not rub it in a timely manner, but just leave it in the dust. In this way, this copper bowl only increases in receiving dirt and filth.
Thus, virtuous ones!
Perhaps there is a person who internally has desires, and internally has desires, but does not know them as they truly are;

One should know that he also does not enjoy practicing, does not practice, and does not make diligent effort. He only abides in seeking desires, and internally seeks and attaches to the mind at the end of life.
Having internally sought and attached to the mind at the end of life, at the end he is also not good, and is not born in a good place.
Why is it so?
Because he internally sought and attached to the mind at the end of life seeking desires.
Virtuous ones!
Perhaps there is a person who internally seeks desires, and internally seeks desires, and knows them as they truly are;
One should know that he enjoys practicing and making diligent effort. He stops seeking desires, has no mind seeking desires, and does not attach to the end of life.
They have no desire and attachment, and when they die, it is also good, and the place where they are reborn is also good.
Why is it so?
Because they have no desire and no attachment.
It is just like, Venerable Sirs!
If someone from a shop or a traveling merchant brings a copper bowl that is dirty and impure.
After bringing it, they wash it from time to time, wipe it from time to time, polish it from time to time, and do not put it in the dust, this copper bowl will later become clean and bright.

If a person internally has desire, they know that internal desire as it truly is;

Because they have no seeking, no desire, and a mind unattached to life.

that person is also like this, internally without desire, they internally without desire, know it as it truly is;

Having their mind end in life without mixed desires, mixed seeking, and attachment, their ending is also good, and their birth is also good.
Why is it so?
Because their mind ends in life without mixed desires, without mixed seeking, and without attachment.
This is what, good people,
the causes and conditions for the first two kinds of people seeking desires and ending their lives with attached minds, one is said to be inferior, and one is said to be supreme;
This is the cause and condition. These two kinds of people, internally without a mind of seeking desires and without attachment, are said to be one who is inferior and one who is supreme.
